ðŸ”¥ zoetic | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and delivering presentations with integrated webcam feed using Markdown.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Markdown presentation with webcam integration â€¢ Slide creation using Markdown/MDX â€¢ Live presentation with screen sharing
ðŸ“– Summary: Zoetic is a JavaScript-based tool for creating and presenting slides using Markdown, with the unique feature of integrating a live webcam feed directly into the presentation. It allows users to create slides using Markdown or MDX, and then present them with their webcam feed overlaid, making it suitable for online meetings and remote presentations. Planned features include green screen support, multi-camera support, and virtual webcam functionality.

ðŸš€ Transfer | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Quickly transfer files between devices on a local network without needing cables, cloud services, or complex configurations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Effortless LAN Sharing â€¢ Configurable Security (IP Permissions, Password Protection) â€¢ Powerful CLI Access (curl-friendly) â€¢ Dual Browse UI (App and Web) â€¢ Quick In-App Transfers (Upload, Paste)
ðŸ“– Summary: Transfer is an Android app that creates a local file server, allowing users to easily upload and download files between devices on the same Wi-Fi network. It offers a simple web interface and command-line access, with security features like IP permissions and password protection.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ The-50-Front-end-Project | CSS
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Learning and improving frontend web development skills through practical projects.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ 50 frontend projects â€¢ HTML, CSS, JavaScript â€¢ React â€¢ Bootstrap â€¢ Tailwind CSS
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a collection of 50 frontend projects designed to help developers enhance their web development skills. The projects cover a wide range of technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Bootstrap, and Tailwind CSS. It serves as a practical resource for learning and skill improvement through hands-on experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ domain-scanner | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Checking domain name availability based on various patterns and filters.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-method Verification (DNS, WHOIS, SSL) â€¢ Advanced Filtering (Regular Expressions) â€¢ Concurrent Processing (Multi-threaded) â€¢ Smart Error Handling (Automatic Retries) â€¢ Detailed Results (Verification Signatures)
ðŸ“– Summary: Domain Scanner is a Go-based tool for checking domain name availability. It uses multiple verification methods like DNS records, WHOIS information, and SSL certificate verification. The tool supports advanced filtering with regular expressions, concurrent processing, and provides detailed verification results, making it easy to find available domain names.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ clippy | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Running large language models locally with a retro-style user interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Simple chat interface â€¢ Batteries included (easy setup, automatic hardware acceleration) â€¢ Custom model support â€¢ Offline operation
ðŸ“– Summary: Clippy is an Electron-based application that allows users to run large language models (LLMs) locally on their computers. It provides a simple, nostalgic chat interface reminiscent of Microsoft Office 1997's Clippy. The application supports GGUF models via Llama.cpp and offers easy setup and offline operation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ ktorm | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying database operations in Kotlin applications using a lightweight ORM framework.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ No configuration files or annotations â€¢ Strong typed SQL DSL â€¢ Flexible queries with fine-grained control â€¢ Entity sequence APIs â€¢ Extensible design
ðŸ“– Summary: Ktorm is a lightweight ORM framework for Kotlin that simplifies database interactions. It offers a strong-typed SQL DSL and sequence APIs, allowing developers to write flexible queries with fine-grained control over generated SQL. The framework is designed to be extensible, supporting custom operators, data types, and database dialects.
